noun.description: A preacher, a pulpiteer. Also: a person who regards the pulpit or preaching as the chief feature of religious worship.

adjective.description: Suggestive of the pulpit; reminiscent of a sermon.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Richard Whitlock (b. ?1616). From pulpit + -arian, probably after e.g. Trinitarian.
